results.title: The Memphis belle: the story of a flying fortress
results.creator_credit: William Wyler and United States. War Dept.
results.brief_description: The story of the B-17 bomber Memphis Belle on its final mission over Germany to bomb the submarine pens at Wilhelmshaven as told by William Wyler. Shows the 8th Bomber Command air crews being briefed and ground crew preparations. Contains rare wartime footage of actual combat conditions.

results.title: Report from the Aleutians
results.creator_credit: John Huston and United States. Army. Signal Corps
results.brief_description: A documentary of life on a lonely airbase on Adak Island in the Aleutians during World War II. For the men of the base, the enemy was the snow, mud, grey skies and boredom punctuated by an occasional bombing raid. John Huston spent six months on the Island and was nearly killed while filming the climactic raid.

results.title: Pearl Harbour December 7th
results.brief_description: A few cameras were on hand to record the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbour on December 7th 1941, film director John Ford’s unit was given the task of recreating many of the major scenes on Hollywood sound stages. Generations of Americans have witnessed the scenes, not realising the attack is actually Ford’s skilful illusion. Historically, the film is accurate in every detail. Winner of the Academy Award for Documentary Production in 1943.

results.title: Scott of the Antarctic
results.creator_credit: Charles Frend, Sir Michael Balcon and Rank Film Productions
results.brief_description: Saga of the ill fated 1912 expedition led by Captain Robert Scott which aimed to be the first to reach the South Pole. Features John Mills, James Robertson Justice and Kenneth Moore.

results.title: Jailhouse rock
results.creator_credit: Richard Thorpe, Pandro S. Berman and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The story of a hard-working young man, jailed for manslaughter, finds an outlet for his frustrations in music, and eventually becomes a rock star. Considered to be Elvis Presley’s best film performance “Jailhouse Rock” features many songs by Jerry Liebler and Mike Stollen, including “Jailhouse Rock”, “Treat Me Nice”, and “Baby I Don’t Care”.

results.title: King Lear
results.creator_credit: Peter Brook, Michael Birkeit, Columbia, Martin Ransohoff Productions and Royal Shakespeare Company
results.brief_description: This Shakespearian tragedy tells the tale of woe when an old king decides to divide his kingdom amongst his daughters. Directed by Peter Brook and starring Paul Scofield and Irene Worth.

results.title: That's entertainment. Part 2
results.creator_credit: David Melnick, Saul Chaplin and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Fred Astaire and Gene Kelly cohost a stunning gallery of classic moments in MGM history. Features memorable performances by John Barrimore, Clark Gable, Greta Garbo and many others including the Marx Brothers, Abbot and Costello, Laurel and Hardy and the inimitable W C Fields. This video includes over ninety legendary superstars.

results.title: A Day at the races
results.creator_credit: Sam Wood, Lawrence Weingarten and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A Marx Brothers movie combining humor and music. The plot, which shifts from a sanitorium to a race track, introduces a horse doctor masquerading as sanitorium director, a jockey who encourages his horse to win by showing it a picture of the man it hates, a vendor of bad racing tips and a vampire dressed in revealing clothing. Also stars Maureen O’Sullivan.

results.title: The Chosen
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Kagan, Edie Landau, Ely Landau and Chosen Film Company
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Chaim Potok which explores the friendship that develops between two adolescent Jewish boys living in New York in the 1940s. The boys are from vastly different Jewish backgrounds, one being an Hasidic Jew and the other a Zionist. Features Rod Steiger, Maximilian Schell as the boys fathers together with Robby Benson and Barry Miller.

results.title: A Hard day's night
results.creator_credit: Richard Lester, Walter Shenson and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Starring the Beatles, this comic fantasia with music uses a multitude of cinematic gags. An enormous commercial success, it led directly to all the kaleidescope swinging London spy thrillers and comedies of the late sixties. In this film the Beatles, harrased by their manager and Paul’s grandpa, embark from Liverpool by train for a London television show.
